item.title: The !nabbe
item.summary: The mode of preparation of the !nábbe ( . . . . ), made from the tail hair of various animals. By /han≠kass’o (L VIII.-11. 7005 rev.-7007 rev.). The tail and tail-hair of various jackals and foxes are compared and used in the making of the brush.
item.comments: 1) Date on p.7005v: 17 August 1878, 2) There is no p.7007v but there are two 7008v pages: the story ends on the first of them, 3) This story is found in Book VIII-11
